entities.label: Investigation of Contractual Irregularities at Pristina Airport
United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo

edges.label: 1. Investigation Conducted By
edges.tooltip: UNMIK conducted the investigation into contractual irregularities at Pristina Airport.

edges.label: 2. Subject of Investigation
edges.tooltip: The investigation focused on procurement irregularities at Pristina International Airport.

edges.label: 3. Administrative Control
edges.tooltip: Administrative control of Pristina International Airport was shifted to KTA on 2002-07-01.

edges.label: 4. Maintenance Cooperation
edges.tooltip: PEAP maintained the airport in cooperation with KFOR under Yugoslavian law from 2001 to 2003.

edges.label: 5. Mandate
edges.tooltip: UNSCR 1244 mandated UNMIK to administer Kosovo, including state-owned assets.

edges.label: 6. Administrative Duties
edges.tooltip: UNMIK Regulation No 1/1999 established UNMIK's administrative duties in Kosovo.

edges.label: 7. Maintenance Partner
edges.tooltip: KFOR was involved in the maintenance of Pristina International Airport alongside PEAP.

edges.label: 8. Recommendation for Action
edges.tooltip: The investigation recommended referring the matter to the D/SRSG of Pillar IV for contract file management.

Pristina International Airport: Addition of a single-source contract for one container following a larger contract.
Absence of proper records and financial approval documents for the main contract.
